channel.title: Compiler help
channel.description: can someone help me i updated to java v 17 and set the gatway but it doesnt work [IMG]http://i247.photobucket.com/albums/gg157/kids_ranqe/compilerproblem.jpg[/img]

item.title: Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

set your environmental variables, and compile with javac

also, for future reference, post all batch file related questions/issues in the sticky.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @iKilem iKilem
item.description:
@iKilem wrote:

It’s really the same thing, give or take a few characters in your batch file.

item.title: Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @mmaKush mmaKush
item.description:
@mmaKush wrote:

[quote=“iKilem, post:6, topic:312420”]If you can’t be bothered to set your environment variables,

@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac" *.java pause [/quote]

Setting your environment variables is better and more efficient than just using your line of code. - No Offense…

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @iKilem iKilem
item.description:
@iKilem wrote:

If you can’t be bothered to set your environment variables,

@echo off
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac" *.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @mmaKush mmaKush
item.description:
@mmaKush wrote:

Since he showed you how to set up your environment variables… Instead of using that long compiler code… Use

javac *.java pause

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @klomp3 klomp3
item.description:
@klomp3 wrote:

Go to “My computer” and click on “View system information” then click on “Advanced”.
Then click on “Environment Variables” after that click on “New”.
Add as name:

CLASSPATH

and as value

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

but only if you have JDK kit 16.
if you have JDK kit 15 it would look like this:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_15\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Then press “Ok” and make another new one named:

PATH

and a value:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin

Also only if you got JDK kit 16,
when you got 15 it would look like this:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_15\bin

Then click “Ok” and again on “Ok” and another time on “Ok” and youre done!
You’re computer will now recognise JDK!

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help
item.dc:creator: @pkinnubpk pkinnubpk
item.description:
@pkinnubpk wrote:

Right click “Edit” on the compile file, and delete the code that is there and add this, that might work.

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic
